title: Confusing error with bad generics in structs "error: expected one of `!`, `(`, `,`, `=`, `>`, `?`, `for`, `~`, lifetime, or path, found keyword `fn`"

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
// Only the *first* error of this kind gets reported
struct FnS<F: fn()> {
    f: F
}

struct InS<I: in> {
    i: I
}

// works like `union` in edition 2015, errors as keywords do in 2018+
struct AsyncS<A: async> {
    a: A
}

// WORKS
struct UnionS<U: union> {
    u: U
}
```
[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=5065c4a01d77d7e17aac442b1f75b7b2)

For structs with a keyword in place of a trait in generics an error of the form

```
error: expected one of `!`, `(`, `,`, `=`, `>`, `?`, `for`, `~`, lifetime, or path, found keyword `fn`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:15
  |
2 | struct FnS<F: fn()> {
  |               ^^ expected one of 10 possible tokens
```
appears. This happens for all keywords, but does not happen for "weak" keywords like `union` or keywords like `async` if compiled in an edition where they were not yet keywords.

Additionally **only the first** of such errors encountered is reported.

I'm not sure what a more clear diagnostic would be for the general case.  However for the `fn` keyword case specifically it should probably include a `help` to use an `Fn` *trait* instead.

This occurs across all compiler versions and editions (barring keyword changes)
Stable 1.57.0
Beta 1.58.0-beta.2
Nightly 1.59.0-nightly 2022-01-02 (8f3238f898163f09726c)
